summary:
We need to produce JSON with keys: summary, business_intent, keywords (list). Must not list method names verbatim. Focus on class responsibility and state/behavior. Provide English.

Class DeployPyTriton: Deploys any models to Triton Inference Server that implements ITritonDeployable interface in nemo.deploy.

Methods: __init__, deploy, run, serve, stop. Provide summary: class orchestrates deployment and lifecycle management of a model on Triton Inference Server, handling configuration, starting server, serving requests, stopping.

Business intent: enable users to quickly expose exported models (e.g., TensorRT LLM) as a Triton service for inference, facilitating integration with downstream applications.

Keywords: deployment, Triton Inference Server, model serving, lifecycle management, ITritonDeployable, inference, GPU, LLM, automation.

Make sure not to list method names verbatim. Avoid using method names directly? The constraint: "Do NOT list method names verbatim." So we should not include "deploy", "run", "serve", "stop" as words? Possibly we can still mention them conceptually but not the exact method names. Safer to avoid those words. Use synonyms: "initialize", "launch", "execute", "terminate". But "deploy" is also a keyword; maybe okay but it's also a method name. To be safe, avoid listing them in summary and business_intent. Use generic terms.

Let's craft summary: "Manages the end‑to‑end process of registering a model that conforms to the Triton deployment interface, configuring the Triton server, and controlling its execution lifecycle."

Business intent: "Provides a streamlined way for developers to expose exported AI models as a Triton inference service, reducing manual setup and enabling rapid integration into production pipelines."

Keywords list: include "Triton", "model serving", "inference", "deployment automation", "GPU", "LLM", "ITritonDeployable", "Nemo", "exported model", "server lifecycle".

Make sure JSON format with double quotes.
